text.0: selfes dōme; i.e., such treasures--and as many--as he desired. Cp. 2775 f.; 2147.--gehleōd. The spelling eo for o (i.e. ō) after l is occasionally met with (Angl. xxv 272; cf. ZfdPh. iv 215). Was it caused in this case by analgy with (Mercian) hleadan? (Or was the scribe thinking of gehēold?）
